text: An airplane view of the heart of New York City. This is the lower portion of Manhattan Island and a section of the Borough of Brooklyn. The upper third of the picture is New Jersey. Three of the five Bridges connecting Manhattan with Brooklyn and Queens boroughs can be seen here: the original Brooklyn Bridge farthest away, next to what is known as the Manhattan Bridge, and the Williamsburg Bridge in the foreground. The Statue of Liberty is visible in the Upper Bay. June 1924 Fairchild Aerial Surveys

Bayonne Bridge
New Jersey
title: Bridges - Bayonne Bridge.

text: Bayonne Bridge, New Jersey
title: Bridges - Bayonne Bridge.

text:
WORLD'S TALLEST BRIDGE SPAN NEARING COMPLETION
NEW YORK CITY -- An excellent and exclusive set of photos on the Great Kill van Kull Bridge which will reach 8,075 feet from Staten Island to Bayonne, N.J. The structure, which is rapidly nearing completion, will have four lanes for vehicular traffic and two lanes for rapid transit. The arch will be 1,675 feet long-- the world's biggest. The span, when completed, will cost about $18,000,000.

Men at work on the bolts of the new span. In the background may be seen Bayonne, N.J.

Photo by Underwood and Underwood

N.D.
title: Bridges - Kill Van Kull Bridge - [World's tallest bridge span nearing completion.]

text:
WORLD'S GREATEST BRIDGE SPAN NEARING COMPLETION

NEW YORK CITY--An excellent and exclusive set of photos on the great Kill van Kull Bridge which will reach 8,075 feet from Staten Island to Bayonne, New Jersey. The structure, which is rapidly nearing completion, will have four lanes for vehicular traffic and two lanes for rapid transit. The arch will be 1,675 feet long--the world's biggest. The span, when complete, will have cost about $18,000,000.

An interesting shot showing a workman on one of the steel girders as a tug passes below.

16970B2  BRIDGE 1  (EXCLUSIVE)
title: Bridges - Kill Van Kull Bridge - [World's greatest bridge span nearing completion.]

text:
WORLD'S GREATEST BRIDGE SPAN NEARING COMPLETION

NEW YORK CITY--An excellent and exclusive set of photos on the great Kill van Kull Bridge which will reach 8,075 feet from Staten Island to Bayonne, New Jersey. The structure, which is rapidly nearing completion, will have four lanes for vehicular traffic and two lanes for rapid transit. The arch will be 1,675 feet long--the world's biggest. The span, when complete, will have cost about $18,000,000.

Two workmen tightening the cables on the span. Staten Island may be seen in the background. 16964323. BRIDGE 2 (EXCLUSIVE)

text:
WORLD'S GREATEST BRIDGE SPAN NEARING COMPLETION

NEW YORK CITY—An excellent and exclusive set of photos on the great Kill van Kull Bridge which will reach 8,075 feet from Staten Island to Bayonne, New Jersey. The structure, which is rapidly nearing completion, will have four lanes for vehicular traffic and two lanes for rapid transit. The arch will be 1,675 feet long—the world's biggest. The span, when complete, will have cost about $18,000,000.

A study in steel—what the motorist sees when he starts across the new bridge.

title: Bridges - Kill Van Kull Bridge - [World's tallest bridge span nearing completion - Staten Island - Bayonne, New Jersey - 8,075 feet long.]

text:
WORLD'S GREATEST BRIDGE SPAN NEARING COMPLETION
NEW YORK CITY.--An excellent and exclusive set of photos on the great Kill van Kull Bridge which will reach 8,075 feet from Staten Island to Bayonne, New Jersey. The structure, which is rapidly nearing completion, will have four lanes for vehicular traffic and two lanes for rapid transit. The arch will be 1,675 feet long—the world's biggest. The span, when complete, will have cost about $18,000,000.
A study in steel—an interesting shot of the arch made from the cement roadway on the span. 16969B2
BRIDGE 8 (EXCLUSIVE)
title: Bridges - Kill Van Kull Bridge.

text:
WORLD'S GREATEST BRIDGE SPAN NEARING COMPLETION

NEW YORK CITY--An excellent and exclusive set of photos on the great Kill van Kull Bridge which will reach 8,075 feet from Staten Island to Bayonne, New Jersey. The structure, which is rapidly nearing completion, will have four lanes for vehicular traffic and two lanes for rapid transit. The arch will be 1,675 feet long--the world's biggest. The span, when complete, will have cost about $18,000,000.

A general view of the almost-completed span--looking toward Bayonne, New Jersey.

BRIDGE 6 (EXCLUSIVE)
